tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE file_comments (
    comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    comment_text TEXT,
    comment_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE reviews (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    comment TEXT,
    rating INT,
    review_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (file_id) REFERENCES files(file_id)
);

CREATE TABLE comments (
    comment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    comment_text TEXT,
    comment_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE ratings (
    rating_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    rating_value INT,
    rating_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE reviews (
    review_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    review_text TEXT,
    review_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE comments (
    comment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT NOT NULL,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    comment_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE ratings (
    rating_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT NOT NULL,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    rating_value INT NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE reviews (
    review_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT NOT NULL,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    review_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    rating_value INT NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE files (
    file_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    file_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    file_size INT NOT NULL,
    file_path TEXT NOT NULL,
    uploaded_by INT NOT NULL,
    uploaded_at TIMESTAMP
);
CREATE TABLE files (file_id INT PRIMARY KEY, file_name VARCHAR(255), file_type VARCHAR(50), file_size INT)
CREATE TABLE comments (comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY, file_id INT, user_id INT, comment_text TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE ratings (rating_id INT PRIMARY KEY, file_id INT, user_id INT, rating_value INT, rated_at TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE reviews (review_id INT PRIMARY KEY, file_id INT, user_id INT, review_text TEXT, rating_value INT, reviewed_at TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50), email VARCHAR(255), created_at TIMESTAMP)
